I'm very new to both Java and JUnit so I apologize if this question is 
just too stupid for words but....

Why does JUnit chop off the end of the message when you have a really 
long string compare in an Assert? For example, we end up with:

1) testStringStuff "expected:<test> but was:<this is a really really 
really really really really really really really really really really 
really really really really ..."

Above may not be exact but illustrates the problem.

Is this a java thing? A JUnit thing? Can I change it? 

- Shelley
subject: Assert Messages getting "chopped" off
